availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas J. Daniel (Owsley County, Kentucky, coal miner, pvt to lieut. colonel 7th Ky Inf. USA)

body.p: Owsley County, Kentucky, coal miner and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John Marcus Daniel and Mary Daniel. Coal miner in Beatyville, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private, first sergeant, second lieutenant, first lieutenant, adjutant and lieutenant colonel from August 19, 1861, to September 24, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, Beatyville, p. 377.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0211.
Find A Grave, "Thomas J Daniel (1836-1922)," Memorial #63624424, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/63624424 (accessed September 14, 2020).
